entry.title: How to consume OData service in Fiori app using approuter and destination in Cloud Foundry (404 Not
entry.content:
Hello Community,

I am developing a CAP project on SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry. I want to consume an OData V4 service from a Fiori (UI5) application using approuter and a destination.

- Backend (CAP, OData V4):
https://<subdomain>-back.cfapps.<region>.hana.ondemand.com/odata/v4/invitacion/ReadProveedor

- Frontend (Fiori + approuter):
https://<subdomain>-frontend.cfapps.<region>.hana.ondemand.com/frontfront/index.html

### Approuter (xs-app.json)
```json
{
"welcomeFile": "/frontfront/index.html",
"routes": [
{
"source": "^/backend/(.*)$",
"target": "/$1",
"destination": "SRV_BACKEND",
"authenticationType": "xsuaa"
}
]
}

 

 

Destination in BTP cockpit

  • Name: SRV_BACKEND
  • URL: https://-back.cfapps..hana.ondemand.com
  • ProxyType: Internet
  • Authentication: OAuth2JWTBearer

 

Frontend manifest.json

"dataSources": {
"backend_odata": {
"uri": "/backend/odata/v4/invitacion/",
"type": "OData",
"settings": { "odataVersion": "4.0" }
}
}

 

Problem

When the app tries to load metadata (/backend/odata/v4/invitacion/$metadata), I receive 404 Not Found.

Accessing the backend service directly via its URL works fine.

What I tried

  • Verified that the destination exists in BTP cockpit and points to the backend URL.
  • Checked the backend service directly (responds correctly).
  • Reviewed approuter logs — I see messages like “Missing internal url for request …”.

What configuration should I adjust in the approuter or the destination so that the frontend Fiori app can correctly consume the OData service via /backend/...?

Any guidance or working examples would be greatly appreciated

entry.title: /SDF/SMONの有効WP
entry.content:
ご担当者様

/SDF/SMONの有効WPの定義をご教示ください、
有効WPとはその時点で実行中のワークプロセスの合計でよいでしょうか？

有効WPには待機中のワークプロセスは含まれないという理解ですが、
これは正しいでしょうか。
弊社環境の/SDF/SMONの画面ショットを添付します。
この例だと8/29午前3:30以降、有効WPが3~4なので実行中のものが3~4で
待機中のワークプロセスが非常にあるという理解です。




------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: /SDF/SMONの有効WP
entry.content:
担当者様

いつもお世話になっております。
お問い合わせにつき、下記回答させていただきます。

ご認識の通り、/SDF/SMON における 「有効WP」には待機中のワークプロセスは含まれておりません。
「有効WP」とは、実際に処理を行っている（アクティブな）ワークプロセスの数を示しています。

以上、よろしくお願い申し上げます。
SAP サポート

entry.title: Should I take Modvigil as soon as I wake up?
entry.content: It is normally advised to take Modvigil as soon as you wake up, particularly if you are using it to treat narcolepsy or excessive daytime drowsiness. Early use lowers the chance of sleeplessness at night and increases alertness during the day. Take it with water and on an empty stomach for optimal effects. Modvigil should be taken around an hour prior to the start of your shift if you are taking it to treat shift work sleep disturbance. Because time might vary depending on your daily activity and particular ailment, always heed your doctor's advise.

entry.title: Re: Clarification on how “Linked Object” is populated for...
entry.content:
Hi @ludgero_vasconcelos 

In our understanding and according to our experience the OCNLearningEvents API only allows you to send completion status on item level but not on content object level.

In our understanding OCN completions only work fine if you have a 1:1 relationship between an LMS item and an OCN Course of your OCN Content Provider. 

To compare: With Scorm 1.2 you can complete a single content object within an item. So an item can have several content objects that have to be completed one by one before the whole item ist marked as completed. But this logic doesn't exist in OCN context. OCN always completes the whole item.

KR Jonas

entry.title: WEBI : filtre conservé
entry.content:
Bonjour,

dans un rapport WEBI contenant des filtres (nom/prenom....), lorsque je souhaite changer le filtre Nom, le filtre Prenom est conservé.

Hello,

entry.title: Transform Your Sales Strategy with GROW with SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 – Now with AI Insights!
entry.content:
In today’s fast-paced business world, sales teams need the right tools to stay competitive. That’s why we’ve updated our GROW with SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 course on the Enterprise Support Academy, now featuring a new chapter on AI for Lead to Cash.

This self-guided e-learning course provides a step-by-step guide to mastering the core features of SAP Sales Cloud, from system setup to managing data and optimizing sales processes. You can work through the material at your own pace, making it easy to fit into your schedule.

The standout addition is Unit 7, which covers SAP Business AI for Lead to Cash. While AI has transformative potential, its implementation requires thoughtful planning. Here’s what you’ll learn:

  • AI Applied to Lead to Cash: How AI streamlines the sales process, offering valuable insights to improve efficiency.
  • Machine Learning: Using machine learning to enhance forecasting and customer personalization.
  • Generative AI: Optimizing workflows and generating content to strengthen customer engagement.
  • CX AI Toolkit: Exploring SAP’s AI tools to elevate your customer experience and refine your sales strategy.

By the end of the course, you’ll have a solid understanding of SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 and practical knowledge of how to use AI to improve decision-making and sales performance.

AI offers great potential, but its implementation should be gradual and well-planned. If you’re looking to modernize your sales operations and leverage the latest in AI technology, this course is a great starting point.

Join us on the Enterprise Support Academy and explore how SAP Sales Cloud and AI can transform your sales strategy: GROW with SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 .

entry.title: SAP Public Cloud / Problem with the Migration of Contact Persons
entry.content:
Hello Experts,
i have a question about the best way to migrate a complex structure of contact persons. Our goul is that the migrated business partners have their associated contact persons in the "contacts" section in the general view of the app "Manage Business Partner Master Data" (compare screenshot). 

The issue is, that there are a few Business Partners that share the same contact person. If we only use the Migration Cockpit and the "customer" migration object, we would, from our understanding, create the same contact person multiple times if we tried to enter them in the contact person section of that migration template, because it always creates a new contact person for every entry. 
Given that, the next logical step would be to migrate the contact persons and the other business partners seperatly and then fix the issue with mass maintenace after that.
My question is, are there apps to mass maintain this information and if so, how is the process ? Or is this a limitation of the Public Cloud and we need to do this manually ?

Best regards
Lukas

entry.title: Re: What exactly is SAP BW PCE… and what it is not !
entry.content:
Dear Max
yes, of course you can convert to SAP BW/4HANA at any time afterward, and also before the "lift&shift".
"Before" means you perform the conversion with the current set up of SMEs in the on-premise environment.
"Afterward" means SAP Enterprise Cloud Services (ECS), who operate the PCE system for you, will to the technical conversion. 
The preparation, which normally consumes most of the BW/4HANA conversion effort, will still rely on your resources in both cases.
Regards Frank

entry.title: Re: Service Interfaces and ABAP Proxy generation support in SAP Integration Suite
entry.content:
Hi Helmut,

The support for ESR standalone also will end by 2027(ext.support end of 2030). Cloud Integration is seen as successor for ESR.

Support for ABAP Proxy generation is also now possible with SAP Integration Suite. In SPROXY transaction it is now possible to configure the IS tenant url in SM59 destination (SAP_PROXY_ESR). I will soon publish the blog for the same.Meanwhile  you can refer to the documentation :

https://help.sap.com/docs/integration-suite/sap-integration-suite/generating-abap-proxy?locale=en-US&version=CLOUD

Regards,

Radhika
